item.title: Issues Under Fire: Its the Global Economy Silly
item.itunes:author: Lee The Cool Guy
item.dc:creator: Lee The Cool Guy
item.description: As evidence continue to emerge to support a worldwide recession is taking hold, it would behoove the Obama administration to get out front with it's solutions for mitigating the impending damages. Accepting the fact of the world's economic interconnectivity without understanding the inherent dangers of its interdependency could lead slower minds to be misled by political hucksters.
item.content:encoded: As evidence continue to emerge to support a worldwide recession is taking hold, it would behoove the Obama administration to get out front with it's solutions for mitigating the impending damages. item.itunes:subtitle: All Politics Are Global

item.title: Issues Under Fire: The Horrors of Houla
item.itunes:author: Lee The Cool Guy
item.dc:creator: Lee The Cool Guy
item.description: Tip Toeing Past the Tipping Point may the only plan left for the international community since too many unknowns have remained for too long. The Syrian picture is getting murkier by the hour. With no way to independently verify the claims of all the fractured factions fighting, any assistance offered beyond bread, bottled water and band-aides may be more damaging than helpful.
item.content:encoded: Tip Toeing Past the Tipping Point may the only plan left for the international community since too many unknowns have remained for too long. The Syrian picture is getting murkier by the hour. With no way to independently verify the claims of all the fractured factions fighting, any assistance offered beyond bread, bottled water and band-aides may be more damaging than helpful.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tip Toeing Past the Tipping Point
item.itunes:summary: After nearly 14 months of protest, demonstrations, government crackdowns, torture, killings, executions and now, daily massacres and blood baths, one would think an assessment of Assad's mental state should be a consideration.

item.title: Issues Under Fire: Chaotic Greece Holds All the Cards
item.itunes:author: Lee The Cool Guy
item.dc:creator: Lee The Cool Guy
item.description: Holding all the cards, the Greeks can force the European Union to renegotiate the austerity deal their previous government signed off on. If you think about it, how can anybody stop them. Buoyed by the French and others, the EU/ Euro Zone appears to be under more pressure than the individual nation's opting for another solution.
item.content:encoded: Holding all the cards, the Greeks can force the European Union to renegotiate the austerity deal their previous government signed off on. If you think about it, how can anybody stop them. Buoyed by the French and others, the EU/ Euro Zone appears to be under more pressure than the individual nation's opting for another solution.
item.itunes:subtitle: Can Greece Bring the World Down?
item.itunes:summary: We are witnessing wholesale chaos building up to one giant global financial crashing crescendo. When the French and Greeks went to the polls, they voted Hell No! to austerity. Consequences be damned, they decided to call the EU's bluff.
item.itunes:keywords: EU, EURO ZONE, Greece, EU Crisis, economy, ireland, austerity measures, germany, national deficits,

item.title: Issues Under Fire: Return of The Drachma A Greek Tragedy
item.itunes:author: Lee The Cool Guy
item.dc:creator: Lee The Cool Guy
item.description: The Greeks announced a second round of elections to be held June 17th in an effort to elect enough representatives willing to cooperate just long enough to form a government. Any government will do for now. Should Greece fail to elect and put together a "coalition of open minds willing to compromise", we estimate within weeks, maybe less, Greeks will make a run on the banks.
item.content:encoded: The Greeks announced a second round of elections to be held June 17th in an effort to elect enough representatives willing to cooperate just long enough to form a government. Any government will do for now. Should Greece fail to elect and put together a "coalition of open minds willing to compromise", we estimate within weeks, maybe less, Greeks will make a run on the banks.
item.itunes:subtitle: Can You Say Drachma
item.itunes:summary: While watching Europe implode has been entertaining, the reality is, you ain't seen nothing yet!
item.itunes:keywords: Greece,EU, Euro Zone, run on banks, ECB, Greek Elections,issues under fire,lee bines,alternative media,drachma

"It's like a dictatorship." BTW, the Bolivian leader also left in disgust.

Actually, this ain’t exactly a bold, or smart prediction since all of the idiots lefts standing thus far are confirmed losers. Every GOP challenger has already been soundly and roundly rejected by the American people in previous contest. So, one has to ask, what has changed about these rejected retreads that would make a plurality of the electorate feel any differently about them now? Answer: Not a God damned thing. Perhaps that is why Republicans are quietly looking for an alternative.
